content.description:
An easy start leads up to a tricky little crux with equally tricky protection. Continue up through cracks to the top of the block. Not an easy onsight!

Located on the far left hand side of the wall just right of a mature Spruce tree. After topping out on the slab follow the fixed line to a tree anchor. Rap to the ground with a 70 meter rope. Rap to climbers left around the arête if you only have a 60 meter.
Single rack to 3". Tree anchor.

climbs.name: Fourth Estate
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Valerie Anctil and Nick Brake, November, 2021

content.description:
A nice mix of crack and face climbing on a variety of cool features. 



Located on the far left hand side of the Green Zone. Start just left of a massive Spruce tree that is quite close to the wall. Follow the clean rock up arete to a bolted anchor on a short slab. 

Single rack to 1 inch piece. Bolted anchor.

climbs.name: Have At 'Er
climbs.fa: Mike Delaney, Denise Hamel and Shawn Bethune

content.description:
Crux is through the middle part of the climb.  It is not easy to find the best line.  Moving left after reaching the first sloping ledge offers the best protection or you can go for the straight line if you don't mind running it out a bit.

Start below a stump 10 feet off the ground 10 feet left of The Space Between or 10 feet right of the Green Zone sign.  Climb up to the stump then continue up in a large pod.  Move slightly left to better gear and follow cracks to the top.  You can rap to the ground on a 60 meter rope but be careful as it is a rope stretcher.
Single rack to 3".  Two bolt rappel station at the top.

Climb straight up aiming for a large tooth shaped block (difficult to see from the ground). Move left around the block and continue up to a big ledge and short headwall. Stop here at the two bolt rap station or continue up to the trop and a tree anchor.

Start about ten feet right of the Green Zone sign. Look for a nice crack system above a little ledge 2 feet off the ground.  Rap the route.
Single rack to 3".  Bolted rappel station.

Climb up and into a short flaring chimney and continue through varied features. Keep right of the tree ledge and continue up through both face and cracks to the second ledge with a two bolt anchor.



Start is directly below a flaring chimney about 40 feet off the deck. Rap the route from the rappel station. It will be a slight rope stretcher with a 60 meter rope.


Single rack to 3". 1 bolt over a run out section. Bolted anchor/rappel station.

Very nice route. A bit hard to stay on as Jaws is within arm's reach with better pro but worth it just the same.  Some elect to top rope first to figure out the beta on the poorly protected sections. Crux is down low on a thin finger crack. Great climbing on gorgeous granite.

Located in the Green Zone just left of Jaws.
Single rack to 2". One bolt protects a run out but this route is still pg.

This is the right facing corner beginning about halfway up the wall.  The climbing down low is not the best but the corner more than makes up for it.  The crux is pulling the lip to get into the corner.  After exiting the corner several options are possible: step left to a ledge and two bolt anchor or continue up the natural line to the top of the cliff.  The climbing after the first ledge is easy but surprisingly enjoyable.

Locate a massive cedar tree near the base of Up Yours. Several starts are possible directly above this tree, some are easier than others. Climb up to a large Spruce tree about twenty feet off the deck then aim for the right facing corner. Surmount the small overlap, climb the corner and continue on easier terrain to a Spruce tree. Rap the route with a 70 meter rope (stretcher) or scramble to the Up Yours anchor if you only have a 60 m and do two raps.
Single rack to 3".  Tree anchor.

This is another very unique route with varied climbing throughout. Gear is a bit tricky but the crux moves through the finger crack protect very well. If you dont like the moves around the crux you can step right onto Merlin to remove the spice.

Located just left of Merlin in the Green Zone.  The start is directly below a white birch tree growing out of the rock about 10 feet off the deck.  Take a plumb line from this point up to a right leaning finger crack near the top.  It is easy to get off route down low on this one so try and stay the course straight up.  Finish on a sloping ledge with and a two bolt rappel station.  Be careful rapping this route as it is a rope stretcher on a 60 meter.  Tie knots!
Standard rack of nuts and cams to a 3" piece.  Bolted rappel station.

climbs.name: Starring Matt Damon
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Denise Hamel and Shawn Bethune

content.description:
Nice easy start on exquisite granite. Good gear all the way with 3 bolts plus one more from the next route to the right that would seem weird not to clip. There are three ways to finish after the last bolt - right, left and straight up. Right and left go at 5.9, straight up is 10a. With one move slightly left onto the neighbouring route the straight up finish feels as though it is the best and most natural line. The section on glacier polished stone on the upper part of the route is both stunning and enjoyable to climb. 


The route is found on the left hand side of the Green Zone. Locate a large mature spruce tree close to the wall at the end. The start is the obvious slot 10 feet right of the tree. Move pretty much straight up from there aiming for a bolt on a slab.
Standard rack to 2" piece. Lots of small gear, 3 bolts. Bolted rappel station. Rap the route.

Pitch 1: 5.6 70 Start is on the far right hand side of the wall directly above a massive cedar tree. Look for a prominent feature of rock that resembles an extended middle finger. Several starts are possible.  All will lead up to the finger then through a system of cracks to a small ledge. Build a gear anchor here and belay or you may opt to do the rest in one long pitch.  
 Pitch 2: 5.7+ 100 Climb up on steeper terrain through the crux then reach another small ledge. Continue up trending slightly left near the top through blocky section.

The route is on the far right hand side of The Green Zone, just left of the X Wall.
Single rack to 3", 4" piece optional.  There is a bolted rappel station at the top.  You can rap to the ground with double ropes or use the intermediate rap station for Emerald City if you only have one rope.

This area of the cliff is less steep and is composed of mostly single pitch routes. The rock quality is excellent and the variety here is quite extraordinary. Check out Jaws if you are looking for a very unique climbing experience. Starring Matt Damon will test your footwork with a tricky crux on glacier polished stone. The most popular route on the wall and possibly the cliff is Up Yours. This is a nice long moderate that can be a challenging onsight.
